results.title: Elevation
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Stephen Cummins
results.brief_description: This queer short film begins with two men in bed next to each other. The focus then shifts to the two men encountering each other in an elevator. As they shift in bed, or begin to make love in the lift, the film becomes a celebration of the body and movement: the erotics are a series of dances choreographed to an experimental music score. This is one of a number of short films directed by Stephen Cummins which integrate modern dance with film.

results.title: Elephant theatre (K)
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Sabrina Schmid
results.brief_description: One man has built a little theatre which he can hold in the palm of his hand. It reveals a world of its own. Yet there remains one dream to be fulfilled: that some elephants will come to live in it.

results.title: Elephant baby
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a baby elephant from its first day in the jungle, through many weeks of training, to the day it joins a working force of elephants in a lumber camp. Photographed in Mysore, India, the film gives an account of the daily activities of working elephants and of the people who train them, including the shooting of a tiger which came too close to the camp for comfort.

results.title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.description:
